JWT.description: The token you get from: "curl -X POST https://debricked.com/api/login_check -d _username=YOUR_USERNAME -d _password=YOUR_PASSWORD", prefixed with "Bearer". Example value: "Bearer YOUR_VERY_LONG_TOKEN"
JWT.name: Authorization

get.summary: Get supported dependency file formats

401.description: Returned when authorisation fails, such as missing JWT-token, insufficient privileges or expired JWT-token. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

get.summary: Get current status of a CI upload. An array consisting of progress and amount of vulnerabilities found (as well as the number of vulnerabilities marked as unaffected) is returned.

parameters.name: extendedOutput
parameters.description: If true, returns an extended output containing stats for each file. When scan is complete, the result can only be fetched once per hour with this option enabled.

200.description: Returned when successful and scan is completed.

201.description: Returned when queue times are long and the scan is not completed.

202.description: Returned when scan is in progress.

401.description: Returned when authorisation fails, such as missing JWT-token, insufficient privileges or expired JWT-token. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

403.description: Returned when you don't have access to one or more uploads/files.

404.description: Returned when given upload doesn't exist.

patch.summary: Edit value `default rules enabled` for the current user.

400.description: Returned when required data is missing or given data is invalid. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

401.description: Returned when authorisation fails, such as missing JWT-token, insufficient privileges or expired JWT-token. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

get.summary: Filter and get the request logs in a paginated fashion. Non-admins will only be able to access their own logs.

parameters.name: eventTypeId
parameters.description: Filter by eventTypeId

parameters.name: userEmail
parameters.description: Filter by user email

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Filter by a specific url

parameters.name: ipAddress
parameters.description: Filter by a specific IP address

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting timestamp to fetch logs, e.g. 2018-05-10T15:52:01

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Ending timestamp to fetch logs, e.g. 2021-05-10T15:52:01

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for paginated content

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Amount of logs to return per page, maximum 50

parameters.name: excludeUnclassified
parameters.description: Setting this parameter to true excludes the logs which do not have an associated labeled event

200.description: Returned when successfully fetched the logs

404.description: Returned when user is not found

403.description: Returned when attempted to access other users' logs while not being an admin

401.description: Returned when authorisation fails, such as missing JWT-token, insufficient privileges or expired JWT-token. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

get.description:
Here, we can switch between using the vulnDB or not (isDatabase). If true, we return data from
e.g. NVD such as published date and updated date. If false, we return the date at which the
vulnerability was discovered by us in the repo.
get.summary: Get the relevant dates for a vulnerability.

parameters.name: vulnerabilityId
parameters.description: Vulnerability ID.

parameters.name: isDatabase
parameters.description: Use vulnerability database. If false, it returns the date at which the vulnerability was found in the repo. If true, it returns the published/updated data from e.g., NVD

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: Repository ID.

400.description: Returned when required data is missing or given data is invalid. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

get.summary: Gets the number of vulnerabilities fixed for the selected time period

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: Repository ID. If empty, all repositories will be checked.

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: The id of the branch to check. If empty, the latest commit on the default branch will be checked

parameters.name: timeFrame
parameters.description: The number of timeScales back to search

parameters.name: timeScale
parameters.description: The scale to search backwards for

parameters.name: excludeManualUploads
parameters.description: The id of the branch to check. If empty will check the default branch

400.description: Returned when required data is missing. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

401.description: Returned when authorisation fails, such as missing JWT-token, insufficient privileges or expired JWT-token. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

get.summary: Gets the current numbers of license risks.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: Repository ID. If empty, all repositories will be checked.

parameters.name: branchId
parameters.description: The id of the branch to check. If empty, the latest commit on the default branch will be checked

parameters.name: excludeManualUploads
parameters.description: The id of the branch to check. If empty will check the default branch

400.description: Returned when required data is missing. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

401.description: Returned when authorisation fails, such as missing JWT-token, insufficient privileges or expired JWT-token. Look at the response body's message to know exactly what went wrong.

commitId.description: CommitId of a repository to extract data from. Note that if this value is provided, the values for repositoryIds and branch will be ignored.

email.description: The email address of the recipient of the finished report. If not set the email of the current authorized user will be used.

repositoryIds.description: RepositoryIds to extract data, default branch will be chosen for all of them.

branch.description: Branch name to select when using a repositoryId

locale.description: The language of the email message, en/sv. Note that the SBOM will always be generated in English.

vulnerabilities.description: Add vulnerabilities matching the components in the SBOM.

rootFixes.description: Add root fixes information to matching vulnerabilities. By default it is true if vulnerabilities is true

licenses.description: Add license data for the components in the SBOM.

sendEmail.description: Send email with SBOM report. When set to false, make sure to download the SBOM through download-generated-cyclonedx-sbom endpoint.

vulnerabilityStatuses.description: Vulnerabilitis only in selected statuses will be added to report. If empty, only 'vulnerable', 'unexamined', 'paused', 'snoozed' will be included.

emails.description: List of emails to send out emails

roles.description: The role IDs which will be assigned to the users

user_group.description: The user group ID which will be assigned to the users

ip_address.description: IP address associated with the request

breadcrumbs.description: Information about the pages the user visted in the UI

notify.description: Should notify owner by email when finished

default.description: If the branch is a default branch or not

spdxIdentifier.description: SPDX license identifier, the license name.

licenseId.description: Id of license, can be used to get further data on the license.

status.description: Tells if dependency is direct, indirect or both

repositoryName.description: Name of the repository containing the dependency.

repositoryId.description: Id of the repository containing the dependency.

branches.description: The names and ids of all the branches containing the dependency

lastPublished.description: Date of the latest published version

selectPage.description: Link to the open source select page

popularity.description: Popularity score connected to the dependency

contributors.description: Contributors score connected to the dependency

security.description: Security score connected to the dependency

timelines.description: Multiple timelines for a given CVE.

notify.description: Should notify owner by email when finished

repository_ids.description: The repository ids to create or edit the rule for

rule_ids.description: The rule ids to be edited. Set to null if creating rule.

conditions.description: The conditions that the rule should consist of.

fail_pipeline.description: If the triggering of a rule should fail the pipeline or not.

warn_pipeline.description: If the triggering of a rule should warn the pipeline or not.

mark_unaffected.description: If the rule should mark the cve the rule triggered for as unaffected.

mark_vulnerable.description: If the rule should mark the cve the rule triggered for as vulnerable.

ignore_if_marked_unaffected.description: If the rule should ignore CVEs marked as unaffected when checking rules.

notify_email_addresses.description: Array of email adresses to notify

notify_user_groups.description: Array of user groups to notify

default.description: If the rule should be created as a default rule or not.

webhook_url.description: The webhook url to send the result to if rule triggers.

webhook_secret.description: The secret for the webhook url.

repository_ids.description: The repository ids to create or edit the rule for

rule_ids.description: The rule ids to be edited. Set to null if creating rule.

conditions.description: The conditions that the rule should consist of.

fail_pipeline.description: If the triggering of a rule should fail the pipeline or not.

warn_pipeline.description: If the triggering of a rule should warn the pipeline or not.

mark_unaffected.description: If the rule should mark the cve the rule triggered for as unaffected.

mark_vulnerable.description: If the rule should mark the cve the rule triggered for as vulnerable.

ignore_if_marked_unaffected.description: If the rule should ignore CVEs marked as unaffected when checking rules.

notify_email_addresses.description: Array of email adresses to notify

notify_user_groups.description: Array of user groups to notify

default.description: If the rule should be created as a default rule or not.

webhook_url.description: The webhook url to send the result to if rule triggers.

webhook_secret.description: The secret for the webhook url.

warnings.description: Warnings to be beware of if activating this rule

description.description: The description of the successfully generated rule

invalidWebhookUrl.description: If the provided webhook url was invalid or not.

errorConditionText.description: If the provided webhook url was invalid or not.

errorConditionIndex.description: If the provided webhook url was invalid or not.

branchName.description: Name of the branch containing the dependency.

branchId.description: Id of the branch containing the dependency.

homePage.description: Home page url of the dependency

dependencies.description: Details about dependencies with the given timeline

allOf.description: The type of object the rule checks
The operation to perform when checking the condition.

value.description: The operation to perform when checking the condition.

allOf.description: The conjunction to perform with a previous condition.

roles.description: Array of access scope IDs. Get ID of scopes from /open/admin/user/options

accessScopes.description: Comma space separated list of access scopes

enabled.description: Value of default_rules_enabled which will be set.

ruleIds.description: Array of rule ids to add default for

repositoryIds.description: Array of repository ids to add default for

Conj.title: Conj
Conj.description: The conjunction to perform with a previous condition.

defaultRuleIds.description: Array of default rule ids to delete

Op.title: Op
Op.description: The operation to perform when checking the condition.

group.description: ID of the group to be deleted

parent.description: ID of the parent of the current groups, this is needed as groups can have multiple parents.

group.description: ID of the group to be edited

products.description: Array of repository IDs to be included in the group

groups.description: Array of subgroup IDs to be included in the group

name.description: New unique name for the group

products.description: Array of repository IDs to be included in the group

groups.description: Array of subgroup IDs to be included in the group

current.description: Decides where the group will be placed. To place it within an existing group, use the id of that group, otherwise use '/' to add it to the root level

privateToken.description: Token used to authenticate to perform pull request on SCM instance

message.description: Information on how to get the report after generation is finished.
message.example: The report has started generating and will be sent to your email once ready. Be aware that it might take some time before it's finished. It is also possible to download the SBOM through the 'download-generated-cyclonedx-sbom' endpoint, by using the reportUuId stated below.

reportUuid.description: Generated report uuid. It's used to download the SBOM report once it's been generated.

notes.description: Specifies notes to consider once the generation has begun. For example if certain parameters are ignored due to conflicts.

Subject.title: Subject
Subject.description: The type of object the rule checks

repositories.description: The id of the repository in question

enforceComment.description: If providing a comment is mandatory to change the remediation status

oldComment.description: Previous comment related to a change in remediation status

oldCommentAutho.description: User which wrote the previous comment

commentMinLength.description: Minimum length necessary to provide a comment

repoId.description: The id of the repository in question

type.description: Review status to be set: 'unaffected', 'vulnerable', 'remediated' or 'unexamined'
